citation.article-title: Halobacteroides lacunaris sp. nov.‚ a new saccharolytic anaerobic extremely halophilic organism from lagoonic hypersaline Lake Chokrak.

p.s: Description of Halobacteroides lacunaris sp. nov.
Halobacteroides lacunaris (adj. lagoonal, from lagoon-like lakes in lacubus lacunaribus)
Nonsporulating cells, slightly bent flexible rods, single, paired, in short chains and strands, dimansions 0.7-1.0 x 0.5-6.0 μm.
Colonies lens-shaped, with a straight edge, light yellow, 0.5-1.0 mm in diameter.
A wide selection of carbohydrates utilized, with sucrose and trehalose preferred.
Products of glucose fermentation are acetate, ethanol, H2 and CO2, Hydrolyses starch and glycogen.
Forms hydrogen sulfide in the presence of So.
No growth occurs at and below 5% NaCl.
Optimum pH for growth 6.5-7.0, with limits at 6.0 and 8.0.
Habitat: Lagoon-like salt lakes with varying salinity up to the point of halite precipitation.
Typical strain, Z-7888 (=DSM), isolated from the silt of lake Chokrak (Kerch Peninsula).
